page.title: 02RECREATION
page.content: On average, people living in { {MARPLE, MELLOR }and {MARPLE BRIDGE spend between 5 and 15 hours each week on sporting activities, the most popular of which are football, swimming, squash, tennis, walking, sailing, climbing, bowling, badminton, keep fit classes, golf, archery, athletics, horse riding, rifle shooting, table tennis, orienteering, boating, rugby and cycling. Many attend football or rugby matches as spectators, but many also participate in some kind of sporting activity. Because the area is one of picturesque natural beauty, there are many local people who enjoy walking in the area as well as the numerous visitors to the area who come to walk in the parks and also along the popular canals which run through Marple.
